III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/14/24, while youth was at the gym, a staff member walked
up to the youth and punched him 5 times in the left shoulder.
Youth's shoulder hurt and they were transported for a medical
evaluation at the hospital.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/16/2024 an email was sent to Foster Care Worker (FCW)
from DHHS Specialist and myself. The FCW was advised of the
allegations and additional background information on Youth A was
requested. FCW was also asked to provide any concerns related
to Youth A being placed at Wolverine Center.
On 12/17/2024 an in-person meeting was completed with
Program Manager. A request was made for video footage and
incident reports, however she advised she was unable to gain
access to video or incident reports at this time. She advised she
will make a list and work with Chief Administrator to obtain all
requested documentation. Program Manager was advised of the
allegations. She advised that Staff 1 may have been the one-to-
one staff for Youth A Yesterday. She denied being aware of any
incident between Youth A and Staff 1. Program Manager advised
that Youth A went AWOL multiple times in the last several days.
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. He was
asked about the incident that occurred on 12/14 in the gym. Youth
A reported he got hit 5 times with an open hand. I displayed what
open hand and closed fist looked like and Youth A changed his
response and indicated that he was hit with a closed fist. He
reported being hit on his forehead and arms. He denied having
any marks or bruises from this. He did not remember who hit him
and was unable to describe or name the person that hit him, but
said it was a male. He then indicated that he was not sure if it
was a staff or youth that hit him. He reported he was outside
when he was hit and staff told him to go back into the building.
Youth A was then asked if he was in the gym and he changed his
response and stated he was actually in the gym when he got hit.
2

He reported that other staff and peers were present but could not
provide names or describe them. He denied that he told any
Wolverine staff what had happened, but stated he told the police
and the police told the ambulance and hospital staff. Youth A
stated that after the incident, he went AWOL and was located by
the police and that is when he told them what happened. He
reported that he went to the hospital but denied having any
injuries. Youth A was asked about his interactions with Staff 1.
He confirmed knowing him and denied that Staff 1 was the staff
that punched him on 12/14/24.
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 2
at Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. She reported
she has worked at Wolverine for 2 years. She was advised of
allegations and denied having knowledge of or being present in
the gym with Youth A during any type of incidents. She denied
that there was a report of any issues or concerns with staff by
Youth A on that day. Staff 2 denied any knowledge of Youth A
having an altercation with staff. She reviewed the log and
confirmed that Staff 1 was not Youth A’s one to one staff on
12/14/2024 but was on 12/15/2024. She did report that she
recalled that Youth A was upset that day. He reported that his
mom had reported to him that his sister had passed away. Staff 2
stated she later was able to confirm that this was not true and that
his mother never reported that to him.
On 12/17/2024 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 3 at
Wolverine. The DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 3
reported that she has worked for the agency for 17 years. She
denied that Youth A has ever reported any concerns to her
relative to not feeling safe or threats made toward him by a staff.
Staff 3 reported that the FCW of Youth A told staff that Youth A
told her Staff 1 was making threats toward Youth A; specifically
threatening to kill him. After this was reported to her, she stated
she spoke with Youth A and he also told her that Staff 1 was
threatening to kill him but could not state when and where it
occurred. He first stated he did not remember, but then said it
happened in the hallway on the first floor. Staff 3 denied ever
hearing Staff 1 make any threats toward Youth A or any other
youth. She also denied that Youth A has ever disclosed to her
that he was assaulted by any staff member at Wolverine. She
reported that Youth A has been evaluated by the psychiatrist and
there is a concern regarding him hallucinating. She reported they
have attempted to get him on prescribed medication, but it has
been challenging due to him frequently going AWOL. Staff 3
reported she spoke to the mother of Youth A via telephone to
3

confirm that his sister did not pass away. His mother expressed
concerns for him hallucinating and reported this is how Youth A
behaves when he has been experiencing hallucinations.
On 12/17/2024 an email response was received from FCW and
she denied any additional concerns with Wolverine placement.
On 12/17/2024 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call if there are any additional concerns.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1
at Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. He advised that
he has been employed with Wolverine since February 2024. Staff
1 denied having any altercations with Youth A during his
placement at Wolverine. He advised that Youth A has a habit of
repeating things he hears and reporting it as if it happened to him.
He denied being the one-to-one staff for Youth A on 12/13/24 or
12/14/2024. Staff 1 reported he possibly has had conversations
with Youth A in the first floor main hallway but none that have
become escalated or in which threats were made. He reported
that Youth A often goes AWOL from the facility. Staff 1 reported
there was a couple of recent times that he was in the gym with
Youth A but denied he ever hit him or that they were involved in
an altercation. He also denied ever hearing Youth A state that a
staff member had hit him on those occasions. Staff 1 denied ever
seeing any staff hit Youth A. He did however confirm that he has
heard Youth A make things up if he didn't get his way.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person interview was held with Staff 4 at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 4 reported
she has worked with the agency for 25 years. She was asked
about the altercation involving Youth A fighting in gym. She
denied recalling the exact date as there have been many
incidents. She stated that when things get heated between two
youth staff always try to prevent them from fighting by separating
them. She denied ever seeing any staff hit Youth A. She denied
that Youth A has ever reported being hit. She did report that she
has overheard Youth A say that he was going to get staff in
trouble because they took his money. She stated this was in
reference to a time when he returned from AWOL with cash and it
was confiscated by staff as youth are not allowed to have cash.
She reported that the cash was placed with the belongings of
Youth A. Staff 4 reported that Youth A gets into it with his peers
all the time. She recalled a time when he got into it with Youth C.
She denied recalling what happened, but believed that Youth C
had hit Youth A. She denied ever seeing Staff 1 get in any
4

physical altercation with a youth. Staff 4 described Staff 1 as a
good staff that never gets violent with the youth. She denied ever
hearing him curse or yell at the youth.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Youth B at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. He confirmed
knowledge of Youth A and reported they had gotten into an
altercation in the bathroom at Wolverine. He stated he punched
Youth A in the eye. He recalled staff was present but could not
recall their names. He stated the staff intervened and nothing else
occurred. Youth B doesn't recall Youth A ever being involved in
an altercation with staff. He denied ever seeing Youth A and staff
involved in any altercations.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Youth C at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. He was very
hesitant and questioned why he needed to be interviewed. Youth
C reported that he didn’t really know Youth A but would see him at
the facility. Youth C expressed his desire not to be interviewed
and left the room.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Youth D at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth D reported
he is familiar with Youth A and they got along well when he was
placed at Wolverine. He denied being aware of Youth A ever
being hit by any staff member. He reported that Youth A lies a lot.
He denied ever hearing Youth A say that staff wanted to physically
harm him.
On 01/13/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 5.
The DHHS Specialist also participated. Staff 5 denied knowledge
of Youth A being hit by staff specifically, Staff 1.
On 01/22/2025 a DHHS Closing Case Conference was held.
DHHS Specialist and Area Manager participated. DHHS
Specialist advised that there are no findings of abuse and/or
neglect.
Documents Reviewed:
WHHS Behavior Management Policy:
All staff are to be certified in Crisis Prevention Institute Non-
Violent Crisis Intervention. Non-violent physical restrictions are
only to be used to protect clients or others from unanticipated or
severely aggressive behavior that places them at risk of violence
or injury if no intervention occurs. Interventions must be guided by
5

a number of factors, including safety of other clients and staff, size
and strength of client, degree of past violent behavior, whether the
client has a weapon, physical or health conditions of the client,
client's Individual Crisis Management Plan. Post-incident
debriefing must also occur
Psychiatric update and medication review of Youth A – Report
is dated 12/19/2024 and states the following: Youth A has
Previous diagnoses PTSD, Autism, Intellectual Disability (FSIQ
49), DM/DD, ADHD, GAD, Intermittent Explosive Disorder, R/o
bipolar disorder. Mother previously reported history of auditory
and visual hallucinations. Reported Youth A first hearing voices at
age 6. Many relatives have psychosis/schizophrenia with multiple
hospital admissions. Stated that choking his sister and killing two
kittens in 2023 were all motivated by the voices and the greatest
concern is managing this symptom. Current diagnosis of Youth A
is unspecified psychosis (childhood onset schizophrenia,
schizoaffective disorder), unspecified intellectual disability, and
autism spectrum disorder.
Incident Reports involving Youth A –
A total of four incident reports were reviewed. They included
12/14/2024 7:05pm (AWOL), 12/15/2024 6:30am (Return from
AWOL), 12/15/2024 (AWOL) and 12/15/2024 2:43pm. None of the
incident reports had to do with an altercation with staff.
Review of Video Footage –
Video #1 12/14/2024 5:37pm Wolverine Center gym with about 6
youth that enter the gym as the video begins. There appears to be
1 staff present. One of the youth grabs a basketball and they walk
to the basketball court. They begin to play basketball. Around
5:41pm another staff enters with what appears to be several more
youth. The youth on the basketball court continue to play. There
are several youths standing by the far-right doors. The wall
partially obstructs the view and actions of youth are not visible.
No staff is observed to be hitting/punching/clapping at youth. The
video ends at 5:52pm.
Video #2 12/15/2024 around 5pm in the gym - no one was seen in
the gym during this time. Youth are usually at dinner around this
time. Several youth do enter the gym around 5:37pm and play
basketball for about 20 minutes. Staff were present with youth, but
were not seen engaging in any inappropriate activity.
Video #3 12/16/2024 1:55pm 1st Floor Main Hallway at Wolverine
Center. Staff 1 is not observed in this video. Nor are any staff or
6

youth observed to engaging in any altercation or escalated
argument.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rules. Interviews were completed
with both staff and youth and review of video footage was
completed, there was not sufficient evidence to support non-
compliance with the licensing rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 (1) A child caring institution shall establish and
Section follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
Description forms of intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment
including, but not limited to: (iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion,
punishment, or otherwise suggesting physical or emotional harm
to a youth.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff threatened youth that if he did not stop going AWOL, he
would take him to an abandoned building and chop up his body.
Investigation Interviews
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth A
reported that Staff 1 told him he was going to “hurt me and kill me
and stuff”. He also reported that Staff 1 told him that if he told
anyone that he is “going to put me in a garbage bag and cut me
open”. Youth A stated he did not know what Staff 1 did not want
him to tell but clarified that Staff 1 told him that he was going to
hurt him. Youth A stated this occurred in the main hallway and
denied that anyone else was around. Youth A reported Staff 1
has threatened him in the past and said he would murder and kill
him and cut him open and put him in a garbage can or abandoned
house, however he could not provide a time frame for when this
occurred and stated it happened “a long time ago”. At this point
in the interview Youth A denied ever being in a physical altercation
with Staff 1. He also denied telling anyone at Wolverine about the
comments he alleged Staff 1 made to him because he said they
would not believe him.
7

On 12/17/2024 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 3 at
Wolverine. The DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 3
reported that she has worked for the agency for 17 years. She
denied that Youth A has ever reported any concerns to her
relative to not feeling safe or threats made toward him by a staff.
Staff 3 reported that the FCW of Youth A told staff that Youth A
told her that Staff 1 was making threats toward him; specifically
threatening to kill him. After this was reported to her, she stated
she spoke with Youth A and he also told her that Staff 1 was
threatening to kill him but could not state when and where it
occurred. He first stated he did not remember, but then said it
happened in the hallway on the first floor. Staff 3 denied ever
hearing Staff 1 make any threats toward Youth A or any other
youth. She also denied that Youth A has ever disclosed to her
that he was assaulted by any staff member at Wolverine.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1
at Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. He advised that
he has been employed with Wolverine since February 2024. Staff
1 denied telling Youth A or any other youth that he would cut them
up and take them to an abandoned house. He advised that Youth
A has a habit of repeating things he hears and reporting it as if it
happened to him. Staff 1 denied hearing any youth talking about
staff threatening to cut them up and put them in an abandoned
building. Staff 1 denied recalling Youth A reporting he was hurt by
staff or that staff had threatened him.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person interview was held with Staff 4 at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 4 reported
she has worked with the agency for 25 years. Staff 4 denied ever
hearing Staff 1 threaten Youth A or any other youth. She
specifically denied hearing any staff threaten to cut Youth A up
and put him in an abandoned house. She denied ever hearing
Youth A report a threat like that either.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Youth B at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. He denied
hearing staff threaten Youth A or any other youth. He denied ever
hearing Youth A state that he was threatened by staff.
On 01/13/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Youth D at
Wolverine. DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth D reported
he is familiar with Youth A and they got along well when he was
placed at Wolverine. Youth D denied ever hearing Youth A say
that staff had threatened to kill him, cut him up or throw him in an
abandoned building.
8

On 01/13/2025 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 5.
The DHHS Specialist also participated. He denied knowledge of
Youth A reporting that he had been threatened by Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed:
WHHS Communication with Youth Policy: WHS believes that
maintaining proper communication with its clients is imperative for
proper treatment. All staff are expected to communicate with
recipients of care (clients) in a professional manner.
Communication not authorized by the Agency will be interpreted
as unprofessional, sexual, predatory, and/or illegal. Specifically,
staff should not swear at, threaten, or communicate in any way
that would violate Child Protection Law. Staff must understand the
relationship with the recipients of care (clients) in our program is
based solely on employment with WHS (i.e., a treatment
relationship exists only as a result of employment with the
Agency).
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews were completed
with both youth and staff and there was not sufficient evidence to
confirm that Staff 1 made threats to Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
